intro: Turnera selloi, commonly known as the Mexican flame flower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and Central America. It is a member of the Passifloraceae family, known for its showy, colorful flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a velvety texture. The flowers are distinctive, with five sepals and five petals, and are usually bright yellow or orange in color.
